intro: Lotononis laticeps, commonly known as the narrow-headed lotonon, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a clustered inflorescence. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
